00001 /*
00002  * $Id$
00003  */
00004  
00005 #include "HTSMUX-driver.h"
00006 
00007 task main () {
00008 
00009   // Variable to hold measurement data from US sensor
00010   byte distance = 0;
00011   
00012   // configure the port for low speed I2C
00013   SetSensor(S1, SENSOR_LOWSPEED);
00014   
00015   // Tell the SMUX to start scanning its ports.
00016   // this takes 500ms
00017   if (!HTSMUXscanPorts(S1)) {
00018     // Scan failed, handle the error
00019     TextOut(0, LCD_LINE1, "Scan failed!");
00020     Wait(1000);
00021   }
00022   
00023   // The sensor in this example is a LEGO Ultra Sound sensor connected
00024   // to the SMUX's 1st port (msensor_S1_1).
00025   // SMUX sensor ports use the following naming standard:
00026   // If the SMUX is connected to the NXT's S1 port, it starts with msensors_S1.
00027   // If the SMUX were to be connected to the S2 port, it would start with msensors_S2
00028   // 
00029   // The second part denotes the SMUX's port, which it has 4 of.
00030   // If the sensor was connected to the SMUX port 1 and the SMUX was connected to 
00031   // the NXT's S1 port, the smuxport would be written as msensor_S1_1.
00032   // If the sensor was connected to the SMUX port 3 with the SMUX still connected 
00033   // to S1, it would be written as msensor_S1_3
00034   
00035   while (true) {
00036     distance = smuxSensorLegoUS(msensor_S1_1);
00037     TextOut(0, LCD_LINE2, "DISTANCE:", true);
00038     NumOut(0, LCD_LINE3, distance);
00039     Wait(100);
00040   }
00041 }
00042

00045  */
